Description: Crude Oil Production: The total amount of crude oil produced, typically measured in barrels.
Natural Gas Production: The total amount of dry natural gas produced, typically measured in cubic feet.
Coal Production: The total amount of coal produced, typically measured in short tons.
Total Energy Production: The total amount of energy produced from all sources, measured in quadrillion Btu.
Liquid Fuels Consumption: The total consumption of liquid fuels, typically measured in barrels.
Natural Gas Consumption: The total consumption of natural gas, typically measured in cubic feet.
Coal Consumption: The total consumption of coal, typically measured in short tons.
Electricity Consumption: The total consumption of electricity, typically measured in kilowatt-hours.
Renewables Consumption: The total consumption of renewable energy sources, typically measured in quadrillion Btu.
Total Energy Consumption: The total amount of energy consumed from all sources, measured in quadrillion Btu.
Crude Oil Price: The average price of crude oil per barrel, measured in dollars.
Natural Gas Price: The average price of natural gas per million Btu, measured in dollars.
Coal Price: The average price of coal per million Btu, measured in dollars.
Real Gross Domestic Product: The total value of all goods and services produced in a country, adjusted for inflation, measured in trillions of dollars.
RGDP Percent Change YOY: The year-over-year percentage change in real gross domestic product.
GDP Implicit Price Deflator: A measure of the overall change in prices within the economy.
GDP IPD Percent Change YOY: The year-over-year percentage change in the GDP implicit price deflator.
Real Disposable Personal Income: The amount of money households have available for spending and saving after taxes and inflation adjustments.
RDPI Percent Change YOY: The year-over-year percentage change in real disposable personal income.
Manufacturing Production Index: An index measuring the production output of the manufacturing sector.
MPI Percent Change YOY: The year-over-year percentage change in the manufacturing production index.
1-Year Treasury Bill Rate: The interest rate on a one-year U.S. Treasury bill, a short-term government debt security.
3-Month Treasury Bill Rate: The interest rate on a three-month U.S. Treasury bill.
Mortgage Rate: The average interest rate charged on mortgages.
Consumer Price Index: A measure that examines the weighted average of prices of a basket of consumer goods and services.
CPI YOY%: The year-over-year percentage change in the consumer price index.
CPI MOM%: The month-over-month percentage change in the consumer price index.
